name: San Luis Creek Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Plantation building (creek view, room 626) for one night. The building and the view were special requests, which were accommodated. All three buildings and the main house are very new and attractively furnished. Our room was not large, but well decorated with a large (king) bed, a TV, a fridge, an arm chair. There was also a coffee/tea maker with Starbucks coffee, hot cocoa, and tea. The bathroom was spacious with two-people shower, a skylight, his and hers sinks and Aveda toiletries. Breakfast was plentiful -- eggs, breads, yogurt, fruit, juices, oatmeal, cereal, sweet baked goods, tea, and coffee. Everyone was friendly and dinner recommendations were right on the money. We liked this place and would not hesitate to recommend to others. When we return, we'd like to try another building, just for variety.
reviews.title: a great stay -- too short

likes.liked: — furnishings, beautiful new buildings, Aveda, breakfast
likes.disliked: — if I had to choose something, the room was a bit smallish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hadn't stayed at a B&B before, but after reading the reviews we decided to stay here for our planned Hearst Castle tours in nearby San Simeon. From the moment we arrived we realized why others had raved about the San Luis Creek. We booked the Bed in Breakfast in Bed special which came with a bottle of wine from a nearby winery. It was chilled and waiting for us when we checked in. We opted to eat in the carriage house both days and breakfast was fantastic! There were many options available and gratis Starbucks to go, which helped as the tours were early in the morning and we had to drive a bit to get there. The rooms are spacious and wonderfully appointed. The four poster bed and fireplace made for a romantic weekend for two very grateful adults. Because it is set up more like a boutique hotel with B&B benefits, we never felt like we were possibly disturbing the proprietors and/or guests at any time. Thank you and we will be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience for our first B&B!

likes.liked: — It is the nicest place we have ever stayed !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at San Luis Creek Lodge twice. The first time was with my son, booked via Hotwire. We got a huge room that was very comfortable. Second time, my husband and I stayed for 1 night to visit my son at Cal Poly. We called and got a small discount for a lovely king room in the Londonderry building, with a fireplace. That room was very tiny, but still nicely furnished. The beds are all wonderfully comfortable and have down comforters. The breakfast is above average, and includes hot eggs of some sort and/or quiche. The dining area is small, but since it's a small lodge, it wasn't very crowded. It's too bad they don't have more land to work with, because the only thing missing is luxurious landscaping and a pool to lounge by. But then, of course, they'd be charging double! The rooms really do feel like you are at an exclusive resort somewhere. I think it's a perfect place for exploring the area and then sleeping in comfort. And it's okay for a couple, who want to lounge in their room, but it's not really sufficient for a family, who'd expect outdoor amenities.
reviews.title: Great rooms, good location, nice breakfast, but no grounds

likes.liked: — The rooms and beds are fabulous!
likes.disliked: — They are completely surrounded by asphalt parking lot - no grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was stunning and had a great location! we had a tasty breakfast at the hotel and went to the beautiful avila beach.. san luis is a great place to visit and the hotel will give you great ideas of where to go! the room was immaculate and all our needs were met. i give this hotel two thumbs up!
reviews.title: Fun in the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to San Luis Obispo in July of 2008. We had a wonderful experience at the San Luis Creek Lodge. The room we stayed in was a craftsmen style with a king-sized bed.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels in San Luis Obispo

likes.liked: — It was a really nice and unique place to stay at a great rate. Better than the cheesey motels nearby.
likes.disliked: — A bit far from downtown, but so were all of the other hotels and B&Bs. This one is one of the best ones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The lodge is along a strip with many hotels within a stones throw. Don't let that deter you.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked a room with two queens. We were in the Londonderry building on the second floor.
reviews.title: Another TripAdvisor winner ;-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole facility is new, was neat as a pin and clearly very well maintained. Our room had a gas fireplace, a very large bathroom, two very nicely made beds with fine sheets and bedding. Lovely English/tudor-styled decor. Nice accents but not overdone.
reviews.title: Excellent base.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet, warm. We slept like babies.
reviews.title: Hotel for the celibate...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the main building was very nice. Self-serve eggs, cereals, juices, coffees, etc. Very good quality. Fresh not plastic wrapped.
reviews.title: Fabulous welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the San Luis Creek Lodge following a pretty awful experience at a Hotel in Buellton where we paid $175 per night for a sub standard room in what seemed like a student dormitory judging by the noises going on all night. When we arrived at the SL Creek Lodge the staff were such a contrast to the last hotel and could not do enough for us, even allowing us to check in early to get some much needed rest. We stayed at the Craftsman building and the room was large and very well furnished. The original artwork on the walls was a nice touch and of a very high standard - we enquired on the artists and the hotel has since e-mailed to pass on information.
reviews.title: Great hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is also worth noting that this hotel reads these reviews and appears to act on them - we saw direct evidence of this during our stay. This appears to be a hallmark of this hotel - they do seem to care. Unfortunatley, something rare these days in this industry.
reviews.title: Blankets and Pillows need cleaning------Yuck!

likes.liked: — Rooms are confortable and very nice
likes.disliked: — The bed smelling like it had not been cleaned in years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have travelled extensively in the USA and in Europe and have enjoyed the full spectrum of hotel experiences. It is no exaggeration to say that this small hotel is way up there on the positive experiences. It has the basics correct - cleanliness, quietness, responsive service and a price which does not make you feel as though you have just been fleeced. What puts it above the rest are the extra touches such as very friendly staff, good quality bathroom products, original art work, original hotel design, very well tendered gardens which mask the neighbouring hotels and a breakfast which is simple but more than adequate and which a bigger name hotel would charge you $20.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have the chance to visit this lovely area then we would highly recommend a visit to the San Luis Creek Lodge!!!
reviews.title: Serenity at the Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel rooms, not your ordinary stuff. But when we opened the door to our room I could smell the bed. The bedspread and pillows have not been cleaned in how long? This is very disappointing especially when you see how nice the rooms are. We were in the Oxnard. The cute little curtain that is draped on the wall behind the bed was loaded with dust. I couldn't believe house keepers do not care enough to dust it off. The breakfest was great, the rooms were great but the bed smelled like musty old cloths. You could literally smell the yuck on your pillows from people that have drooled on them for years. It's like the sheets are the only thing they wash on the bed or replace. All the pillows on the bed stunk, there were other pillows for decoration. Too bad.
reviews.title: Nice Room---but where's the creek?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my boyfriend for two nights en route to LA. We arrived a few hours before check in, but our room was ready, and we were able to get in and relax immediately. We stayed in the Craftsman room 422. It was nicely appointed and had great furniture and a fireplace. The room was large with a king sized bed and an octagonal shaped sitting area with many cute decoration details. My only complaint is that you can not have the closet door open at the same time as the bathroom door. The entrance is bit small but once you get into the room, it is great. It had a large TV, microwave, refrigerator, and a great selection of DVD's to borrow. Breakfast is included and it was delicious! There was a wide selection of options. Everything from oatmeal with delicious fruits to mix in to coffee cake to scrambled eggs. I have stayed at a few different places in SLO, and this is my favorite. I will absolutely come back!
reviews.title: Unique and Relaxing

likes.liked: — Breakfast and comfort of the room
likes.disliked: — entrace way to room really crammed together

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights on our trip to the Central Coast. We had a special $129/night midweek rate for the Nottingham Room in the Londonderry building. The room was a bit small, but the bathroom was large with two sinks and a walk-in shower. We had a fireplace in the room as well. Everything was clean and decorated attractively. The front desk was friendly, although the complimentary breakfast ended a bit early in our opinion. For the price we paid, it was a great experience, and the rooms had much more style than a chain hotel would.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.disliked: — The smallish size of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my friend in this hotel on my way to LA. arrived very late at night and was hesitating which hotel to stay at since i had no previous reservation and san louis obispo has a huge selection of hotels. i was welcomed by the receptionist, who was very professional and very friendly. was able to park my car in the hotel and was given a huge room with 2 queen size beds and a fire place. it was immaculately clean, very newly refurbished and was extra super comfortable.the room had very nice beds, with high-quality very soft cotton linen, very good pillows (which you seldom have in hotels), a huge TV (No flatscreen, but it wouldn't have fit in the decor anyways), a very nice bathroom with Aveda toiletries which is a huge plus. The room was called buckingham palace i think or something, and had traditional english decor, but all very well laid out, very beautifully and tastely decorated. very special attention is paid to the smallest detail and the cleaning staff spend a long time litterally cleaning the bath tub and making the room immaculate.The room had a microwave and a big selection of English historical books. sooooooo charming. DVDs could be rented from the reception area and an ice machine, a very funny one is right besides reception entrance.Breakfast which was included was a huge plus and consisted of very delicious home-made cakes,the lady asked me if i wanted omelettes or something in the morning which she was willing to prepare, fresh fruit, milk, starbucks filtered coffee and very delicious Granola (cereals) which could be mixed with the nuts provided too. It felt like i was home really. This hotel would cost a fortune in a big city without the extra friendliess and professionalism of the staff. Little brownies are provided for guests throughout the day, and the whole experience has been very enjoyable. Paying for the extra money for the fireplace was definitely worth it since i suppose the rooms are nicer and bigger. Being a very demanding customer, i was hugely satisfied by the service and the high quality of this place. If you're going to Heart Castle or just stopping at Saint Louis Obispo, look no further, this is THE place to stay. My room was right in front of the staircase of the first building on the left once you enter the parking. sooooooooooooo loved it and i more than highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Look no further, this hotel is sooooooooooooooooo gorgeous

likes.disliked: — The lack of skimmed milk , hahaha but that's a detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, six month old son and I stayed here for two nights on our way from San Fran to Santa Barbara and had a wonderful stay. We stayed in a room in the Arts & Crafts building which was spotlessly clean, spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great genuine service

likes.disliked: — Little walk to shops and restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: On check in the staff were very very friendly and helpful providing lots of information about the local area, restaurants and attractions - she was a mine of great information!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

aka: San Luis Creek Hotel San Luis Obispo
description: San Luis Obispo's newest hotel ideally located close to charming downtown San Luis Obispo, 5 minutes from Cal Poly, and just 1 hour to Hearst Castle. Luxury spacious rooms feature premium furnishings, luxury upholstery, top-of-the-line bedding and dual pedestal sink bathrooms with imported tile. Extended Continental breakfast with delicious pastries, different breads, bagels and English muffins to toast, hot fresh oatmeal, scrambled eggs upon request and more, large flat-screen Sony televisions and DVD players. There are complimentary DVD rentals located in the Front Office.
